info.title: NetworkManagementClient
info.description: The Microsoft Azure Network management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with Microsoft Azure Networks service to manage your network resources. The API has entities that capture the relationship between an end user and the Microsoft Azure Networks service.

get.description: Gets the specified network watcher by resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: networkWatcherName
parameters.description: The name of the network watcher.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a network watcher resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates a network watcher in the specified resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: networkWatcherName
parameters.description: The name of the network watcher.

requestBody.description: Parameters that define the network watcher resource.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting network watcher resource.

201.description: Create successful. The operation returns the resulting network watcher resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the specified network watcher resource.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: networkWatcherName
parameters.description: The name of the network watcher.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: networkWatcherName
parameters.description: The name of the network watcher.

requestBody.description: Parameters supplied to update network watcher tags.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting network watcher resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all network watchers by resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of network watcher resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all network watchers by subscription.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of network watcher resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Gets the current network topology by resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: networkWatcherName
parameters.description: The name of the network watcher.

requestBody.description: Parameters that define the representation of topology.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the topology of resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Verify IP flow from the specified VM to a location given the currently configured NSG rules.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: networkWatcherName
parameters.description: The name of the network watcher.

requestBody.description: Parameters that define the IP flow to be verified.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the result of IP flow verification.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Gets the next hop from the specified VM.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: networkWatcherName
parameters.description: The name of the network watcher.

requestBody.description: Parameters that define the source and destination endpoint.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the next hop from the VM.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Gets the configured and effective security group rules on the specified VM.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: networkWatcherName
parameters.description: The name of the network watcher.

requestBody.description: Parameters that define the VM to check security groups for.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns security group rules on the VM.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets a packet capture session by name.

parameters.name: packetCaptureName

parameters.name: resourceGroupName

post.description: NOTE: This feature is currently in preview and still being tested for stability. Gets the relative latency score for internet service providers from a specified location to Azure regions.

parameters.name: networkWatcherName

requestBody.description: Parameters that determine Azure reachability report configuration.

200.description: Successful request for Azure reachability report.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: NOTE: This feature is currently in preview and still being tested for stability. Lists all available internet service providers for a specified Azure region.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the network watcher resource group.

requestBody.description: Parameters that scope the list of available providers.

200.description: Successful request for list of available providers.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Gets Network Configuration Diagnostic data to help customers understand and debug network behavior. It provides detailed information on what security rules were applied to a specified traffic flow and the result of evaluating these rules. Customers must provide details of a flow like source, destination, protocol, etc. The API returns whether traffic was allowed or denied, the rules evaluated for the specified flow and the evaluation results.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: networkWatcherName
parameters.description: The name of the network watcher.

requestBody.description: Parameters to get network configuration diagnostic.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the result of network configuration diagnostic.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

NetworkWatcher.description: Network watcher in a resource group.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the network watcher resource.

NetworkWatcherListResult.description: Response for ListNetworkWatchers API service call.

targetResourceGroupName.description: The name of the target resource group to perform topology on.

targetVirtualNetwork.description: The reference to the Virtual Network resource.

targetSubnet.description: The reference to the Subnet resource.

TopologyParameters.description: Parameters that define the representation of topology.

createdDateTime.description: The datetime when the topology was initially created for the resource group.

lastModified.description: The datetime when the topology was last modified.

Topology.description: Topology of the specified resource group.

associations.description: Holds the associations the resource has with other resources in the resource group.

TopologyResource.description: The network resource topology information for the given resource group.

name.description: The name of the resource that is associated with the parent resource.

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource that is associated with the parent resource.

associationType.description: The association type of the child resource to the parent resource.

TopologyAssociation.description: Resources that have an association with the parent resource.

VerificationIPFlowParameters.description: Parameters that define the IP flow to be verified.

targetResourceId.description: The ID of the target resource to perform next-hop on.

direction.description: The direction of the packet represented as a 5-tuple.

localPort.description: The local port. Acceptable values are a single integer in the range (0-65535). Support for * for the source port, which depends on the direction.

remotePort.description: The remote port. Acceptable values are a single integer in the range (0-65535). Support for * for the source port, which depends on the direction.

localIPAddress.description: The local IP address. Acceptable values are valid IPv4 addresses.

remoteIPAddress.description: The remote IP address. Acceptable values are valid IPv4 addresses.

targetNicResourceId.description: The NIC ID. (If VM has multiple NICs and IP forwarding is enabled on any of them, then this parameter must be specified. Otherwise optional).

VerificationIPFlowResult.description: Results of IP flow verification on the target resource.

access.description: Indicates whether the traffic is allowed or denied.

ruleName.description: Name of the rule. If input is not matched against any security rule, it is not displayed.

NextHopParameters.description: Parameters that define the source and destination endpoint.

targetResourceId.description: The resource identifier of the target resource against which the action is to be performed.

targetNicResourceId.description: The NIC ID. (If VM has multiple NICs and IP forwarding is enabled on any of the nics, then this parameter must be specified. Otherwise optional).

NextHopResult.description: The information about next hop from the specified VM.

routeTableId.description: The resource identifier for the route table associated with the route being returned. If the route being returned does not correspond to any user created routes then this field will be the string 'System Route'.

SecurityGroupViewParameters.description: Parameters that define the VM to check security groups for.

SecurityGroupViewResult.description: The information about security rules applied to the specified VM.

networkInterfaces.description: List of network interfaces on the specified VM.

SecurityGroupNetworkInterface.description: Network interface and all its associated security rules.

securityRuleAssociations.description: All security rules associated with the network interface.

SecurityRuleAssociations.description: All security rules associated with the network interface.

networkInterfaceAssociation.description: Network interface and it's custom security rules.

subnetAssociation.description: Subnet and it's custom security rules.

defaultSecurityRules.description: Collection of default security rules of the network security group.

NetworkInterfaceAssociation.description: Network interface and its custom security rules.

SubnetAssociation.description: Subnet and it's custom security rules.

PacketCapture.description: Parameters that define the create packet capture operation.

target.description: The ID of the targeted resource, only VM is currently supported.

bytesToCapturePerPacket.description: Number of bytes captured per packet, the remaining bytes are truncated.

totalBytesPerSession.description: Maximum size of the capture output.

timeLimitInSeconds.description: Maximum duration of the capture session in seconds.

storageLocation.description: The storage location for a packet capture session.

filters.description: A list of packet capture filters.

PacketCaptureParameters.description: Parameters that define the create packet capture operation.

storageId.description: The ID of the storage account to save the packet capture session. Required if no local file path is provided.

storagePath.description: The URI of the storage path to save the packet capture. Must be a well-formed URI describing the location to save the packet capture.

filePath.description: A valid local path on the targeting VM. Must include the name of the capture file (*.cap). For linux virtual machine it must start with /var/captures. Required if no storage ID is provided, otherwise optional.

PacketCaptureStorageLocation.description: The storage location for a packet capture session.

localIPAddress.description: Local IP Address to be filtered on. Notation: "127.0.0.1" for single address entry. "127.0.0.1-127.0.0.255" for range. "127.0.0.1;127.0.0.5"? for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Default = null.

remoteIPAddress.description: Local IP Address to be filtered on. Notation: "127.0.0.1" for single address entry. "127.0.0.1-127.0.0.255" for range. "127.0.0.1;127.0.0.5;" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Default = null.

localPort.description: Local port to be filtered on. Notation: "80" for single port entry."80-85" for range. "80;443;" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Default = null.

remotePort.description: Remote port to be filtered on. Notation: "80" for single port entry."80-85" for range. "80;443;" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Default = null.

PacketCaptureFilter.description: Filter that is applied to packet capture request. Multiple filters can be applied.

name.description: Name of the packet capture session.

id.description: ID of the packet capture operation.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

properties.description: Properties of the packet capture result.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the packet capture session.

PacketCaptureResultProperties.description: The properties of a packet capture session.

name.description: The name of the packet capture resource.

id.description: The ID of the packet capture resource.

captureStartTime.description: The start time of the packet capture session.

packetCaptureStatus.description: The status of the packet capture session.

stopReason.description: The reason the current packet capture session was stopped.

packetCaptureError.description: List of errors of packet capture session.

TroubleshootingParameters.description: Parameters that define the resource to troubleshoot.

QueryTroubleshootingParameters.description: Parameters that define the resource to query the troubleshooting result.

targetResourceId.description: The target resource ID to query the troubleshooting result.

storageId.description: The ID for the storage account to save the troubleshoot result.

storagePath.description: The path to the blob to save the troubleshoot result in.

TroubleshootingResult.description: Troubleshooting information gained from specified resource.

startTime.description: The start time of the troubleshooting.

endTime.description: The end time of the troubleshooting.

code.description: The result code of the troubleshooting.

TroubleshootingDetails.description: Information gained from troubleshooting of specified resource.

id.description: The id of the get troubleshoot operation.

TroubleshootingRecommendedActions.description: Recommended actions based on discovered issues.

actionUri.description: The uri linking to a documentation for the recommended troubleshooting actions.

actionUriText.description: The information from the URI for the recommended troubleshooting actions.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

FlowLogPropertiesFormat.description: Parameters that define the configuration of flow log.

targetResourceId.description: ID of network security group to which flow log will be applied.

targetResourceGuid.description: Guid of network security group to which flow log will be applied.

storageId.description: ID of the storage account which is used to store the flow log.

retentionPolicy.description: Parameters that define the retention policy for flow log.

format.description: Parameters that define the flow log format.

flowAnalyticsConfiguration.description: Parameters that define the configuration of traffic analytics.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the flow log.

FlowLogProperties.description: Parameters that define the configuration of flow log.

storageId.description: ID of the storage account which is used to store the flow log.

retentionPolicy.description: Parameters that define the retention policy for flow log.

format.description: Parameters that define the flow log format.

FlowLogStatusParameters.description: Parameters that define a resource to query flow log and traffic analytics (optional) status.

targetResourceId.description: The target resource where getting the flow log and traffic analytics (optional) status.

RetentionPolicyParameters.description: Parameters that define the retention policy for flow log.

days.description: Number of days to retain flow log records.

FlowLogFormatParameters.description: Parameters that define the flow log format.

type.description: The file type of flow log.

version.description: The version (revision) of the flow log.

FlowLogInformation.description: Information on the configuration of flow log and traffic analytics (optional) .

targetResourceId.description: The ID of the resource to configure for flow log and traffic analytics (optional) .

flowAnalyticsConfiguration.description: Parameters that define the configuration of traffic analytics.

TrafficAnalyticsProperties.description: Parameters that define the configuration of traffic analytics.

networkWatcherFlowAnalyticsConfiguration.description: Parameters that define the configuration of traffic analytics.

TrafficAnalyticsConfigurationProperties.description: Parameters that define the configuration of traffic analytics.

workspaceId.description: The resource guid of the attached workspace.

workspaceRegion.description: The location of the attached workspace.

workspaceResourceId.description: Resource Id of the attached workspace.

trafficAnalyticsInterval.description: The interval in minutes which would decide how frequently TA service should do flow analytics.

ConnectivityParameters.description: Parameters that determine how the connectivity check will be performed.

preferredIPVersion.description: Preferred IP version of the connection.

ConnectivitySource.description: Parameters that define the source of the connection.

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource from which a connectivity check will be initiated.

port.description: The source port from which a connectivity check will be performed.

ConnectivityDestination.description: Parameters that define destination of connection.

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource to which a connection attempt will be made.

address.description: The IP address or URI the resource to which a connection attempt will be made.

port.description: Port on which check connectivity will be performed.

hops.description: List of hops between the source and the destination.

ConnectivityHop.description: Information about a hop between the source and the destination.

address.description: The IP address of the hop.

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource corresponding to this hop.

ConnectivityIssue.description: Information about an issue encountered in the process of checking for connectivity.

context.description: Provides additional context on the issue.

IssueContext.description: A key-value pair that provides additional context on the issue.

HTTPConfiguration.description: HTTP configuration of the connectivity check.
HTTP configuration of the connectivity check.

providerLocation.description: Parameters that define a geographic location.

azureLocations.description: Optional Azure regions to scope the query to.

startTime.description: The start time for the Azure reachability report.

endTime.description: The end time for the Azure reachability report.

AzureReachabilityReportParameters.description: Geographic and time constraints for Azure reachability report.

city.description: The name of the city or town.

AzureReachabilityReportLocation.description: Parameters that define a geographic location.

aggregationLevel.description: The aggregation level of Azure reachability report. Can be Country, State or City.

providerLocation.description: Parameters that define a geographic location.

reachabilityReport.description: List of Azure reachability report items.

latencies.description: List of latency details for each of the time series.

AzureReachabilityReportItem.description: Azure reachability report details for a given provider location.

score.description: The relative latency score between 1 and 100, higher values indicating a faster connection.

AzureReachabilityReportLatencyInfo.description: Details on latency for a time series.

country.description: The country for available providers list.

state.description: The state for available providers list.

city.description: The city or town for available providers list.

AvailableProvidersListParameters.description: Constraints that determine the list of available Internet service providers.

AvailableProvidersList.description: List of available countries with details.

providers.description: A list of Internet service providers.

states.description: List of available states in the country.

providers.description: A list of Internet service providers.

cities.description: List of available cities or towns in the state.

providers.description: A list of Internet service providers.

NetworkConfigurationDiagnosticParameters.description: Parameters to get network configuration diagnostic.

targetResourceId.description: The ID of the target resource to perform network configuration diagnostic. Valid options are VM, NetworkInterface, VMSS/NetworkInterface and Application Gateway.

profiles.description: List of network configuration diagnostic profiles.

NetworkConfigurationDiagnosticProfile.description: Parameters to compare with network configuration.

protocol.description: Protocol to be verified on. Accepted values are '*', TCP, UDP.

source.description: Traffic source. Accepted values are '*', IP Address/CIDR, Service Tag.

destination.description: Traffic destination. Accepted values are: '*', IP Address/CIDR, Service Tag.

destinationPort.description: Traffic destination port. Accepted values are '*' and a single port in the range (0 - 65535).

NetworkConfigurationDiagnosticResponse.description: Results of network configuration diagnostic on the target resource.

results.description: List of network configuration diagnostic results.

NetworkConfigurationDiagnosticResult.description: Network configuration diagnostic result corresponded to provided traffic query.

NetworkSecurityGroupResult.description: Network configuration diagnostic result corresponded provided traffic query.

securityRuleAccessResult.description: The network traffic is allowed or denied.

evaluatedNetworkSecurityGroups.description: List of results network security groups diagnostic.

EvaluatedNetworkSecurityGroup.description: Results of network security group evaluation.

appliedTo.description: Resource ID of nic or subnet to which network security group is applied.

rulesEvaluationResult.description: List of network security rules evaluation results.

ruleName.description: Name of the matched network security rule.

action.description: The network traffic is allowed or denied. Possible values are 'Allow' and 'Deny'.

name.description: Name of the network security rule.

protocolMatched.description: Value indicating whether protocol is matched.

sourceMatched.description: Value indicating whether source is matched.

sourcePortMatched.description: Value indicating whether source port is matched.

destinationMatched.description: Value indicating whether destination is matched.

destinationPortMatched.description: Value indicating whether destination port is matched.

ConnectionMonitor.description: Parameters that define the operation to create a connection monitor.

source.description: Describes the source of connection monitor.

destination.description: Describes the destination of connection monitor.

autoStart.description: Determines if the connection monitor will start automatically once created.

testConfigurations.description: List of connection monitor test configurations.

testGroups.description: List of connection monitor test groups.

notes.description: Optional notes to be associated with the connection monitor.

ConnectionMonitorParameters.description: Parameters that define the operation to create a connection monitor.

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource used as the source by connection monitor.

port.description: The source port used by connection monitor.

ConnectionMonitorSource.description: Describes the source of connection monitor.

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource used as the destination by connection monitor.

address.description: Address of the connection monitor destination (IP or domain name).

port.description: The destination port used by connection monitor.

ConnectionMonitorDestination.description: Describes the destination of connection monitor.

name.description: The name of the connection monitor endpoint.

resourceId.description: Resource ID of the connection monitor endpoint.

address.description: Address of the connection monitor endpoint (IP or domain name).

filter.description: Filter for sub-items within the endpoint.

type.description: The behavior of the endpoint filter. Currently only 'Include' is supported.

items.description: List of items in the filter.

ConnectionMonitorEndpointFilter.description: Describes the connection monitor endpoint filter.

type.description: The type of item included in the filter. Currently only 'AgentAddress' is supported.

address.description: The address of the filter item.

ConnectionMonitorEndpointFilterItem.description: Describes the connection monitor endpoint filter item.

name.description: The name of the connection monitor test group.

disable.description: Value indicating whether test group is disabled.

ConnectionMonitorTestGroup.description: Describes the connection monitor test group.

name.description: The name of the connection monitor test configuration.

testFrequencySec.description: The frequency of test evaluation, in seconds.

protocol.description: The protocol to use in test evaluation.

preferredIPVersion.description: The preferred IP version to use in test evaluation. The connection monitor may choose to use a different version depending on other parameters.

httpConfiguration.description: The parameters used to perform test evaluation over HTTP.

tcpConfiguration.description: The parameters used to perform test evaluation over TCP.

icmpConfiguration.description: The parameters used to perform test evaluation over ICMP.

successThreshold.description: The threshold for declaring a test successful.

ConnectionMonitorTestConfiguration.description: Describes a connection monitor test configuration.

path.description: The path component of the URI. For instance, "/dir1/dir2".

requestHeaders.description: The HTTP headers to transmit with the request.

validStatusCodeRanges.description: HTTP status codes to consider successful. For instance, "2xx,301-304,418".

preferHTTPS.description: Value indicating whether HTTPS is preferred over HTTP in cases where the choice is not explicit.

disableTraceRoute.description: Value indicating whether path evaluation with trace route should be disabled.
Value indicating whether path evaluation with trace route should be disabled.

checksFailedPercent.description: The maximum percentage of failed checks permitted for a test to evaluate as successful.

roundTripTimeMs.description: The maximum round-trip time in milliseconds permitted for a test to evaluate as successful.

ConnectionMonitorSuccessThreshold.description: Describes the threshold for declaring a test successful.

type.description: Connection monitor output destination type. Currently, only "Workspace" is supported.

workspaceSettings.description: Describes the settings for producing output into a log analytics workspace.

ConnectionMonitorOutput.description: Describes a connection monitor output destination.

ConnectionMonitorWorkspaceSettings.description: Describes the settings for producing output into a log analytics workspace.

startTime.description: The start time of the connection snapshot.

endTime.description: The end time of the connection snapshot.

hops.description: List of hops between the source and the destination.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

properties.description: Properties of the connection monitor result.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the connection monitor.

startTime.description: The date and time when the connection monitor was started.

monitoringStatus.description: The monitoring status of the connection monitor.

ConnectionMonitorResultProperties.description: Describes the properties of a connection monitor.
